newsitem.title: USA: Sears to pay $40 mln to states - Mass offical.
newsitem.headline: Sears to pay $40 mln to states - Mass offical.

text.p: Sears, Roebuck and Co has agreed to pay $40 million to U.S. states as part of its settlement of a case involving credit card payments wrongly gathered from consumers, an official with the Massachussetts Attorney General's Office said Thursday.
George Weber, head of the Massachussetts Consumer Division, told a U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Boston that Sears has agreed to the $40 million payment following negotiations with 40 Attorneys General.
So far, 35 Attorneys General have approved the settlement and all 50 states are expected to agree to it.
